placelabel
  • Reference
  • News

Place labels

A place label is a simple data structure that exists to plot spatial data as labels.

placelabel(x, text = NULL, ...)

# S3 method for default
placelabel(x, text = NULL, ...)

# S3 method for sf
placelabel(x, text = NULL, ...)

Arguments

x

a spatial object, sf or anything convertible with `sf::st_as_sf` supported
text

the name of the column to be used as a label
...

arguments passed to `graphics::plot`,

Value

a data frame 'placelabel'

See also

plot.placelabel

Examples

library(sf)
north_carolina <- read_sf(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package="sf"))
nc_labs <- placelabel(north_carolina)
#> using column 'AREA' for labels
plot(st_geometry(north_carolina))
plot(nc_labs, add = TRUE, cex = 0.8)
